image.altText: A group of people sit or stand in a barbecue shelter.

props.synopsis: John Lowe's "tiny one-bedroom residence" is all he needs — and all he can afford — but he and other long-term residents of a northern Tasmanian caravan park are worried they'll be evicted as a result of a council crackdown.

title.children: 'They're not rich people': Caravan park residents told their homes may be 'non-compliant', and they'll have to go

image.altText: A composite of Sue Hickey, Kristie Johnston and John Tucker.

props.synopsis: Five of the independent candidates running in Tasmania's state election have been in parliament before, four of them used to be party MPs. Meet the independents who want another chance.

title.children: An axe to grind or a fresh start? Meet the independents who want another chance in Tasmania

image.altText: Four people stand in front of heavy machinery and fallen timber logs.

props.synopsis: The Liberals say opening more forests to logging would "give certainty" to sawmillers and logging contractors, but the Tasmanian Forest Products Association says the Liberals are using the industry as a "political football".

title.children: Liberals plan to give more Tasmanian native forest to loggers. But the industry isn't on side

image.altText: An aerial image shows a volcanic island emitting white smoke surrounded by clear blue sea on a clear day.

props.synopsis: Several of the guilty parties in the long-running prosecution over the Whakaari White Island disaster have been sentenced in Auckland.

title.children: NZ Judge tells volcano owners 'the world is watching' in sentencing over White Island disaster

image.altText: AAP Linda White

props.synopsis: The prime minister says Labor's hearts are broken at news Victorian senator Linda White has died after an illness.

title.children: 'Our hearts are broken': Victorian Labor senator Linda White dies

image.altText: FACEBOOK GENERIC PHOTO

props.synopsis: Facebook owners Meta says it won't renew commercial deals with Australian news media companies worth millions of dollars.

title.children: Meta won't renew commercial deals with Australian news media

image.altText: A still frame of a video uses graphics to highlight two specific weapons

props.synopsis: A month before a massacre in Papua New Guinea's highlands, videos emerged of the high-powered weapons tribes in the region now have in their possession.

title.children: The videos that should have raised an alarm in PNG that blood was about to be shed

image.altText: Former Bishop of Broome Christopher Saunders departs Broome Magistrate's Court alongside supporters.

props.synopsis: A West Australian court allows details of a sexual assault case against former Bishop of Broome Christopher Saunders to be made public, including information about 26 criminal charges.

title.children: Details of sex assault case against former Catholic Bishop of Broome revealed after suppression order lifted

image.altText: Donuts

props.synopsis: A new first-of-its-kind review finds "strong evidence" that junk food is linked to more than 30 health problems, including higher risks of cancer, heart disease and early death. We've unpacked the latest findings.

title.children: A new first of its kind review links junk food to over 30 health issues. This is what we know

image.altText: Peter Dutton speaks in a courtyard at Parliament House

props.synopsis: The opposition leader says he won't agitate for the politician who betrayed Australia to be named, after a warning from the spy chief that doing so could expose ASIO's sources and methods.

title.children: Dutton cools on push to name 'traitor' politician, after ASIO warns it could expose sources and methods

image.altText: Mitch Marsh holds his finger up and runs through after a wicket

props.synopsis: Cameron Green and Josh Hazlewood dominate the first session with the bat before Australia's bowlers strike early to leave the tourists well on top on day two at Basin Reserve. Follow the action in our live blog.

title.children: New Zealand dramatically collapses as Aussies take charge on day two at Basin Reserve

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: THAT'S TEA! New Zealand 5-42 trails Australia by 341 runs
RAVINDRA IS OUT! BRILLIANT CATCH AT POINT!
RUN OUT! DISASTER FOR THE KIWIS!

image.altText: An animated gif showing an animation of impact on a small asteroid, leaving it slighly deformed

props.synopsis: With help from powerful computers and astrophysicist (and Queen guitarist) Brian May, scientists believe Dimorphos has been "completely reshaped".

title.children: Scientists simulated the impact of NASA's asteroid-smashing mission. Here's what they found

image.altText: Illustration of a smashed piggy bank leaking coins, with a hammer in the foreground.

props.synopsis: New analysis from industry super funds shows the Morrison government's early release of superannuation scheme could hit future taxpayers with as much as $85 billion in additional costs, as people who dipped into their super savings are forced to rely on the aged pension.

title.children: Cost of early super withdrawals expected to reach $85 billion, cost future taxpayers $3,000, warn industry funds

image.altText: A composite image of Robert and Malcolm Cole

props.synopsis: Malcolm Cole was Indigenous and gay. He later died from HIV but in 1988 he created a "stirring" moment at Sydney's Mardi Gras and now his twin brother is determined to make sure his legacy lives on.

title.children: Captain Cook is marching at Mardi Gras and it's not the first time

subjects.title: Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander Art

image.altText: housing estate shot from a drone

props.synopsis: House prices rose in all capital cities except Hobart in February as demand outstrips supply and buyers hope for an interest rate cut later this year.

title.children: House prices are picking up again but analysts say there's a 'ceiling' on growth

image.altText: A bald police officer speaks at a podium.

props.synopsis: Victoria Police has denied using racial profiling after a former immigration detainee was wrongfully arrested and charged over a sexual assault in the inner Melbourne suburb of Richmond.

title.children: Police deny racial profiling after former immigration detainee was wrongfully arrested over sexual assault

image.altText: A wounded Palestinian man lies on a cart as Palestinians gather to wait for trucks carrying bags of flour to arrive.

props.synopsis: Health authorities in Gaza claim Israeli troops opened fire on people waiting for aid near Gaza City, reportedly killing more than 100 Palestinians and wounded hundreds more.

title.children: Gaza authorities say Israeli troops opened fire near aid trucks, IDF says trampling happened

image.altText: A white woman with light brown hair smiles for the camera.

props.synopsis: An off-duty police officer who abducted and murdered a 33-year-old woman in south London three years ago should never have been employed in the first place, with three police forces failing to spot clear signals of his unsuitability, an official inquiry says.

title.children: London police 'repeatedly failed' to spot warning signs when hiring officer who killed Sarah Everard

image.altText: Triple zero number about to be called on a mobile phone.

props.synopsis: Staff at Telstra's national call centre were forced to email emergency referrals to triple-0 operators in some states after services went down.

title.children: National triple-0 call centre hit by outage causes 'complete chaos', ambulance union claims

image.altText: A hole in the ground in front of a building with two people looking over a fence

props.synopsis: A sinkhole has opened up at a two-storey commercial building in southern Sydney this morning, at a site above the M6 tunnel construction.

title.children: Sinkhole opens outside Sydney building above M6 tunnel as tunnelling work stopped

image.altText: Anthony Burke wearing a black polo shirt leaning against a dining table in a well-lit living room

props.synopsis: Host of Grand Designs Transformations and professor of architecture Anthony Burke says there are ways to set up your project so it runs to time and budget — but you might not like what it involves.

title.children: Architecture professor Anthony Burke has seen many renos go over budget and time. Here are his tips to keep things on track

image.altText: Anthony Albanese in a grey suit and tie holds up a purple booklet in front of three flags

props.synopsis: The prime minister has the foreign stage coming to him as he prepares for the special ASEAN summit in Melbourne. But with the Dunkley by-election only days before, he may have other things on his mind.

title.children: The voters of Dunkley have government and opposition in a guessing game

image.altText: Dark storm clouds swallow blue sunlit skies

props.synopsis: Australia has closed the curtain on a wet, hot and muggy summer that saw "a bit of everything" — ranking as the third warmest overall, and third wettest for an El Niño year. See how your city fared.

title.children: Summer recap and autumn forecast: What's in store after months of heavy rain and heat?

image.altText: Tennis player Alex de Minaur hits a forehand during a Mexican Open match against Stefanos Tsitsipas.

props.synopsis: Alex de Minaur beats former world number three Stefanos Tsitsipas for the first time in 11 meetings, reaching the semifinals in Acapulco to keep his Mexican Open defence alive.

title.children: 'No-one beats me 11 times in a row': Alex de Minaur breaks losing streak against Stefanos Tsitsipas to reach semifinals

image.altText: Grace Wilson smiles.

props.synopsis: Recently capped Young Matilda Grace Wilson has become the first Australian professional soccer player to come out as non-binary.

title.children: Australia's first professional soccer player to come out as non-binary hopes to pave the way for others

image.altText: A man and woman, with their baby in a pram, looking at the ASX stock market boards in Sydney.

props.synopsis: The ASX 200 sets an intraday record high after US inflation figures came in close to expectations, keeping rate cut hopes alive. Follow the day's events and insights as they happen with our business reporters on the ABC News live markets blog.

title.children: ASX sets intraday record high, after US inflation offers no surprises

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Australia Post flags downsizing retail network to curb growing losses
Commonwealth Bank offers redeployment to employees affected by job cuts
Meta won't renew commercial deals with Australian news media

image.altText: Happy man and sad man composite.

props.synopsis: After 30 years as a licensed snake catcher in Forbes, Paul Newcombe has been forced to retire after being bitten for a third time by the world's second most venomous snake.

title.children: Veteran snake catcher forced to retire after another eastern brown bite leaves him in intensive care

image.altText: A head and shoulders shot of Australian coronavirus victim James Kwan smiling outdoors and waving a hand in the air.

props.synopsis: When James Kwan became the first Australian casualty from the virus in 2020, it was only weeks later his beloved tourism industry was brought to its knees.

title.children: Four years after a tourism stalwart's death from COVID-19, how is his beloved industry recovering?

image.altText: A sign at a football stadium

props.synopsis: Rugby league has been trying to make it in America for almost a century. Is the NRL's looming trip to Las Vegas the moment they finally strike gold?

title.children: As rugby league launches its newest American adventure, can the NRL hit the jackpot in Las Vegas?

image.altText: Anne Berthelsen using menopause medication

props.synopsis: From full body aches and pains to burning hot flushes and wild, anxious mood swings, the twists and turns Anne Berthelsen-Murray's body takes through the worst of menopause are no trivial annoyance.

title.children: Women 'tearing their hair out' amid continuing global shortage of vital menopause medication

image.altText: A woman with long dark hair wearing a business jacket poses for a photo inside a modern building.

props.synopsis: There are calls for a specialised crimes unit following revelations in a Four Corners and Guardian Australia investigation.

title.children: Australia urged to do more to investigate alleged genocide perpetrators in the country

image.altText: Dozens of high school boys students, in uniform, in a grandstand, cheering on their rugby team.

props.synopsis: With several single-sex schools announcing they'll go co-ed in coming years, the debate about whether gendered schooling is better for your children has again reared its head. We ask education experts, advocates and a neurologist to break down the evidence.

title.children: With the single-sex vs co-ed debate back in the news, we asked experts what type of school is better

image.altText: Taylor Swift sings into a microphone on stage in Sydney while dressed in a sequin bodysuit.

props.synopsis: Tens of thousands of Swifties are flying into Singapore over the next week because of a deal the city-state government struck to be the only South-East Asia country to host Taylor Swift.

title.children: Why Taylor Swift's exclusive Singapore show is stirring up political controversy

image.altText: Alcor Life Extension Foundation cryogenic chambers.

props.synopsis: Li Zehou was a leading light of the Chinese aesthetics movement in the 1980s, but after he died in 2010, his final wish was to have his brain frozen in the hopes of proving his biggest theory.

title.children: The strange last request of one of China's great intellectuals

image.altText: Ley is looking at Dutton as they walk through a corridor. Dutton is smiling.

props.synopsis: Opposition Leader Peter Dutton and his deputy Sussan Ley are chastised after the Liberal Party jumped on the arrest of a former immigration detainee that later was revealed to have been wrongly made.

title.children: Liberals chastised for 'lynch mob' after revelations ex-immigration detainee was wrongly arrested
